content:
• Tuesday, June 26, 2012
  • AVAV

    More on AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV): FQ4 misses on revenue but beats on a per share basis as the...

    More on AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV): FQ4 misses on revenue but beats on a per share basis as the company posted higher unmanned aircraft sales, though margins weakened. The company also issued an upbeat outlook for the new fiscal year, now expecting FY earnings of $1.41 to $1.51 per share on revenue of $348M to $370M. Street expectations are for an EPS of $1.44 on $349M in revenue. Shares +8.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 PM
  • ORLY

    O'Reilly Automotive (NASDAQ:ORLY) lowers Q2 same-store sales guidance to 2% - 2.5% from prior 3%...

    O'Reilly Automotive (NASDAQ:ORLY) lowers Q2 same-store sales guidance to 2% - 2.5% from prior 3% - 5%, saying comparable store sales in June were below expectations, and sees the trend continuing through the end of the quarter. As a result Q2 EPS is expected now to be in the lower end of the previously announced range of $1.13 to $1.17. Shares -4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 PM
  • ZNGA

    Though Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) sold off following its Unleashed announcements (I, II), Majesco...

    Though Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) sold off following its Unleashed announcements (I, II), Majesco Entertainment (COOL +5.2%) shot higher after it was learned the company would be one of Zynga's developer partners for its Facebook-independent Zynga With Friends gaming network. Shares are up another 6.6% AH following a Majesco PR formally announcing the partnership, and stating Zynga will publish Majesco's Mini Putt Park Facebook game.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • HRB

    More on H&R Block (NYSE:HRB): FQ4 misses on a per share basis while coming in line with...

    More on H&R Block (NYSE:HRB): FQ4 misses on a per share basis while coming in line with revenue expectations. Total revenue declined by 2.2% Y/Y however, due in large part to a previously announced strategic realignment and litigation expenses. Client share grew in both the assisted and digital categories, reaching a record 25.6M clients for the year. Shares +2.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV): FQ4 EPS of $0.80 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $110.7M (+4.4% Y/Y)...

    AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV): FQ4 EPS of $0.80 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $110.7M (+4.4% Y/Y) misses by $1.3M. Shares +5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +5.2%) closed with a healthy gain thanks to a new round of M&A chatter. The...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +5.2%) closed with a healthy gain thanks to a new round of M&A chatter. The latest rumors appear to involve Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT). Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) has been named as a prospective suitor for the mobile game developer in prior speculation.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • EA

    Also announced at Zynga Unleashed: 1) A public API that gives third-party developers access to...

    Also announced at Zynga Unleashed: 1) A public API that gives third-party developers access to the Zynga With Friends network, as well as to Zynga's cloud infrastructure. 2) The Ville, a Facebook game that bears a strong resemblance to EA's The Sims Social. 3) A restaurant game called ChefVille. 4) A promise that FarmVille 2 will be coming soon. Zynga (ZNGA -5%) sells off on the news following a big rally likely aided by short-covering. (live blog)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • GOLD

    Barrick Gold's (ABX -3.3%) announcement of a new CFO who jumped ship from Agnico Eagle (AEM...

    Barrick Gold's (ABX -3.3%) announcement of a new CFO who jumped ship from Agnico Eagle (AEM -3.6%) isn't helping shares today, as miners felt the impact of Comex gold falling nearly 1% as part of negative overall sentiment for commodities. GG -1.1%, KGC -1.5%, IAG -1.6%, AUQ -2%, NG -3.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • BSPM

    Chinese drug manufacturer Biostar Pharmaceuticals (OTC:BSPM +10%) jumps after signing a Letter...

    Chinese drug manufacturer Biostar Pharmaceuticals (OTC:BSPM +10%) jumps after signing a Letter of Intent with the Fourth Military Medical University in China to jointly carry out clinical trials for the Viacom Pine II Cream, a drug that treats skin diseases such as bacterial and fungal infections. The letter has been turned in to China's military authorities and is awaiting consent.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • JRCCQ

    Standard & Poor's downgrade of James River Coal (JRCC -15%), which forecast...

    Standard & Poor's downgrade of James River Coal (JRCC -15%), which forecast deteriorating liquidity for the company based on the likelihood of weaker coal markets through 2013, is reverberating through the coal sector, also sending peers plummeting: PCX -7.6%, ACI -5.1%, ANR -2%, BTU -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 23 Comments
  • ROAN

    Janney Montgomery's Jody Lurie explains Linn Energy's (LINE +2%) plans for an IPO to buy up to...

    Janney Montgomery's Jody Lurie explains Linn Energy's (LINE +2%) plans for an IPO to buy up to $1B in LINE shares: "In some sense the new entity serves as a proxy investment for institutional investors that cannot take advantage of MLP tax treatment." LINE will finance its acquisition of BP's Jonah Field properties with borrowings from its $3B revolver, which Janney expects funds from the IPO to repay.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 6 Comments
  • MEOH

    Methanex (MEOH -4.8%) is downgraded to Market Perform with a reduced price target of $35, down...

    Methanex (MEOH -4.8%) is downgraded to Market Perform with a reduced price target of $35, down from $42, at Raymond James. The firm cites signals suggesting Chinese and global economies are slowing, and stiff headwinds recently put forth by its U.S. energy team about the potential impact retreating oil prices will have on key industry indicators.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • DWDP

    Dow Chemical (DOW -2.2%) is downgraded to Neutral from Overweight at J.P. Morgan, which sees the...

    Dow Chemical (DOW -2.2%) is downgraded to Neutral from Overweight at J.P. Morgan, which sees the company as the most expensive of its peers and likely contains the highest earnings risk. The firm maintains its $36 price target on the shares; it believes LYB, WLK and EMN offer more attractive exposure to the sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +3.7%) is rallying yet again - shares are now up 30% from their June 6 low, and...

    Facebook (FB +3.7%) is rallying yet again - shares are now up 30% from their June 6 low, and down less than 13% from their $38 IPO price. IPO underwriters launch coverage tomorrow, and from the looks of things, the Street is expecting a long line of bullish reports.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • BMY

    Citigroup says to buy the dip in Bristol-Myers (BMY +1.5%). The firm believes the FDA's complete...

    Citigroup says to buy the dip in Bristol-Myers (BMY +1.5%). The firm believes the FDA's complete response letter on Eliquis will be resolved quickly and should delay the U.S. launch of the drug by only by a couple of months. The delay won't significantly change its estimates, and the it maintains its a $40 price target on the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • RHHBY

    In addition to consolidations at its New Jersey R&D facility, Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY +1.9%) says...

    In addition to consolidations at its New Jersey R&D facility, Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY +1.9%) says Jean-Jacques Garaud, its head of Pharmaceutical Research and Early Development, is leaving the company effective June 30. Mike Burgess, currently Global Head Oncology and Large Molecule Research, will become acting head until a replacement its found, reporting directly to CEO Severin Schwan.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • FHN

    First Horizon (FHN +5.3%) surges higher amidst word it will take a $272M charge for bad...

    First Horizon (FHN +5.3%) surges higher amidst word it will take a $272M charge for bad mortgages it may be forced to buy back from Fannie and Freddie. It's not what an owner of the bank would call good news, except for the removal of some uncertainty, which is often enough. Morgan Stanley upgrades to Overweight.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • PSUN

    Pacific Sunwear (PSUN +5.5%) runs up a gain after a SEC filing reveals that one of its directors...

    Pacific Sunwear (PSUN +5.5%) runs up a gain after a SEC filing reveals that one of its directors ponied up for 30K shares, continuing a relatively strong trend over the last 2 months of insiders buying.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • SAPE

    IT services providers Sapient (SAPE -6.5%) and Cognizant (CTSH -1.8%) sell off after Goldman...

    IT services providers Sapient (SAPE -6.5%) and Cognizant (CTSH -1.8%) sell off after Goldman downgrades shares to Sell on concerns about Euro demand, financial sector woes, and forex. Goldman notes Cognizant and Sapient derive 41% and 31% of their sales, respectively, from the financial sector, and believes Europe's problems are affecting both discretionary and consumer-driven IT spending. Both Cognizant and industry giant Infosys (NASDAQ:INFY) offered weak guidance this spring.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • SHPG

    Shire (SHPGY +3.2%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Societe Generale, citing...

    Shire (SHPGY +3.2%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Societe Generale, citing the company's strong cash generation potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • VECO

    LED/solar/hard drive equipment maker Veeco Instruments (VECO +4.6%) is rallying on an upgrade to...

    LED/solar/hard drive equipment maker Veeco Instruments (VECO +4.6%) is rallying on an upgrade to Buy from Stifel. The firm, which is setting a $48 PT, thinks LED industry conditions are unlikely to worsen from here, even if it doesn't expect an immediate rebound, and argues Veeco's low valuation (it trades at less than 8x trailing EPS, though earnings are declining) limits downside.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • FUL

    H.B. Fuller (FUL +7.7%) shares are strong after the specialty chemicals maker reports FQ2 EPS of...

    H.B. Fuller (FUL +7.7%) shares are strong after the specialty chemicals maker reports FQ2 EPS of $0.56, beating consensus by $0.01, and a 43% Y/Y gain in revenues to $527M vs. $524 consensus. FUL raises its full-year EPS forecast to $2.10-$2.15 vs. its prior view of $1.94-$2.14, citing cost savings from a recently acquired adhesives business.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • LXRX

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX +14%) pops after Stifel Nicolaus added the stock to its Select...

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (LXRX +14%) pops after Stifel Nicolaus added the stock to its Select List on the back of positive results from the Phase 2b trial of its LX4211 drug for Type 2 diabetes. The firm also says it's upbeat about the rest of the company's pipeline, and it raises its price target to $4 from $3.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS -2.8%) and Leap Wireless (LEAP -0.8%) trade lower after Goldman slashes its...

    MetroPCS (PCS -2.8%) and Leap Wireless (LEAP -0.8%) trade lower after Goldman slashes its targets on fresh concerns about competition from both nationwide carriers and virtual carriers piggybacking on their infrastructure. The firm thinks MetroPCS could report a first-ever drop in subscribers and service revenue in Q2, and expects both companies to trade lower near-term until the arrival of positive catalysts later this year. (Q1 results) (Bernstein)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • YGE

    More on Goldman's downgrade of Yingli (YGE -5.3%):  Analyst Amy Song declares the ugly...

    More on Goldman's downgrade of Yingli (YGE -5.3%):  Analyst Amy Song declares the ugly down-cycle faced by Yingli and other Chinese solar names to be the result of a "vicious circle" of government-supported expansion, international dumping, foreign tariffs, domestic dumping, and further expansion. Song doesn't see crashing polysilicon prices bottoming until late 2012/early 2013, and expects module prices to remain pressured in 2013. (LDK Solar)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • MDVN

    Medivation (MDVN +1.2%) moves up on positive comments out of William Blair this morning. The...

    Medivation (MDVN +1.2%) moves up on positive comments out of William Blair this morning. The firm raised its selling price estimate for the company's prostate cancer treatment enzalutamide, based on what it sees as superior data compared with its competitors. The firm maintains an Outperform rating and raises its price target to $119 from $96.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • IFNNY

    Infineon (OTCQX:IFNNY) provides the latest evidence the chip industry's recovery from its...

    Infineon (OTCQX:IFNNY) provides the latest evidence the chip industry's recovery from its inventory correction is losing momentum (I, II, III): the company warns it expects June quarter revenue to be down slightly Q/Q, compared with prior guidance of flat sales. The warning led Infineon shares to fall 13.4% on the Frankfurt exchange, and could also be pressuring shares of rival Euro chipmaker STMicroelectronics (STM -4.9%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • GEVO

    Gevo (GEVO +7.9%) shares surge after yesterday's news that it will collaborate with BioFuel...

    Gevo (GEVO +7.9%) shares surge after yesterday's news that it will collaborate with BioFuel Energy (NASDAQ:BIOF) to pursue large-scale isobutanol production. "We have the potential to be at the forefront of the advanced biofuel market," Gevo CEO Patrick Gruber says. BIOF "recognizes this potential and has agreed to explore a possible retrofit of their assets to produce isobutanol."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • CNVR

    ValueClick (VCLK -8.1%) slides after receiving a downgrade to Neutral from Piper, which is...

    ValueClick (VCLK -8.1%) slides after receiving a downgrade to Neutral from Piper, which is setting a PT of $15. The online ad services provider, which is facing tough competition from Google (NASDAQ:GOOG), crashed following its Q1 report (I, II), and hasn't recovered.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • TVIAQ

    Solazyme (SZYM -4.3%) and Bunge (BG +0.7%) break ground on a 100K metric ton renewable oil...

    Solazyme (SZYM -4.3%) and Bunge (BG +0.7%) break ground on a 100K metric ton renewable oil production facility adjacent to Bunge's Moema sugarcane mill in Brazil. The firms say construction started on schedule, and the plant is targeted to be operational in Q4 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • PTEN

    Patterson-UTI Energy (PTEN -1.8%) shares are downgraded to Sector Perform at RBC Capital,...

    Patterson-UTI Energy (PTEN -1.8%) shares are downgraded to Sector Perform at RBC Capital, which also lowers its target price to $16 from $24. The firm says while it continues to expect PTEN's corporate transformation strategy to play out over the long-term, it is stepping to the sidelines near-term in the face of developing industry headwinds.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • PDS

    Precision Drilling (PDS -2.6%) is downgraded to Sector Perform with a target price of $8, down...

    Precision Drilling (PDS -2.6%) is downgraded to Sector Perform with a target price of $8, down from $10, by RBC, which says its channel checks indicate falling crude and nat gas prices have begun to impact the land drilling market, a point emphasized in reduced guidance from PDC. The firm expects reduced demand from E&P companies for rigs, which should pressure volume and pricing/margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • SNX

    Distribution-services company Synnex (SNX -2.9%) slips after its FQ2 revenue came up short of...

    Distribution-services company Synnex (SNX -2.9%) slips after its FQ2 revenue came up short of estimates this morning. Despite the shortfall, net earnings rose 9.5% Y/Y as lower input costs and better margins helped to offset softer revenue, due largely to a change in its business model. The company also lowered FQ3 guidance, now expecting to earn $0.91 - $0.95 on revenue in the range of $2.55B - $2.65B. Street estimates are for $1.00 on revenue of $.2.68B.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • LDK

    LDK Solar (LDK -8.4%) slides towards its all-time lows after badly missing Q1 estimates and...

    LDK Solar (LDK -8.4%) slides towards its all-time lows after badly missing Q1 estimates and issuing bleak guidance thanks to the solar industry's overcapacity and pricing issues. LDK expects Q2 revenue of $220M-$270M ($370.4M consensus), and 2012 revenue of $1.5B-$2B ($2.07B consensus). Moreover, the company has a history of being too optimistic with full-year forecasts. Other solar names trading lower: YGE -4.6%. STP -3.9%. SPWR -2.7%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • NTR

    Fertilizer stocks advance for a second day after the price of new corn rises to its highest...

    Fertilizer stocks advance for a second day after the price of new corn rises to its highest since November on the government's report of greater than expected damage to corn crops. Also providing a lift is a Macquarie note that fertilizer companies should be able to significantly increase their dividends. AGU +1.5%, MOS +4%, POT +4%, CF +3.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • AEZS

    Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) +24% after final Phase 3 results for its AEZS-130 drug show that...

    Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) +24% after final Phase 3 results for its AEZS-130 drug show that it's safe and effective in diagnosing adult growth hormone deficiency, which can cause diminished lean body mass, poor bone density, and psychological symptoms. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) trades 4.4% lower in early action despite positive critical reviews...

    Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) trades 4.4% lower in early action despite positive critical reviews for the Model S and rah-rah comments streaming out from Wall Street. The price action on TSLA has the large short interest held on the stock as a major backdrop.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 2 Comments
  • JIVE

    Jive Software (JIVE +4.1%) CEO Tony Zingale boasts he has been receiving calls from customers of...

    Jive Software (JIVE +4.1%) CEO Tony Zingale boasts he has been receiving calls from customers of rival Yammer who are worried about its sale to Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT). However, he admits the deal could cause prospective Jive customers to hold off on buying, as they wait to see how Microsoft integrates Yammer with SharePoint. Separately, Capstone predicts LinkedIn (LNKD +1.9%) will offer its own private social networking platform, and notes the company is testing a solution internally.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • MM

    Millennial Media (MM +6.9%) jumps after Canaccord starts coverage with a Buy and $18 PT. The...

    Millennial Media (MM +6.9%) jumps after Canaccord starts coverage with a Buy and $18 PT. The firm talks up the mobile ad market's growth potential and Millennial's position within the space (#2 in display ads behind Google), and sees international expansion driving upside to estimates. Millennial remains down over 40% from its IPO-day levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • APOL

    A number of education stocks trade higher after Apollo Group (APOL +8.4%) knocked off a big...

    A number of education stocks trade higher after Apollo Group (APOL +8.4%) knocked off a big earnings beat for FQ3 and gave the beat-up sector some positive news amid political scrutiny and ongoing enrollment pressure. Advancers: STRA +5.5%, DV +2.4%. CECO +2.4%, ESI-OLD +3.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM

  • Market preview: Shares are set to rebound from their losses yesterday, with S&P futures...

    Market preview: Shares are set to rebound from their losses yesterday, with S&P futures +0.1%, although EU stocks are mixed as Spanish and Italian debt yields again surge in auctions. New Corp +6.5% on a WSJ report that the company may split in two, while Apollo is +5.9% following its earnings beat. Later: Consumer Confidence, Richmond Fed Mfg.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • SUPN

    Premarket gainers: SUPN +38%. SCMF +12%. NWSA +7%. APOL +6%. Losers: JRCC -8%. LDK -7%.

    Premarket gainers: SUPN +38%. SCMF +12%. NWSA +7%. APOL +6%.
    Losers: JRCC -8%. LDK -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • YGE

    Yingli Green Energy (NYSE:YGE) -3.5% premarket as shares are cut to Sell from Neutral with a $2...

    Yingli Green Energy (NYSE:YGE) -3.5% premarket as shares are cut to Sell from Neutral with a $2 price target from $4 by Goldman Sachs, which cites a "worsening balance sheet with a cyclical trough yet to arrive." The firm says it is concerned about YGE's business strategy in an extremely challenged industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • JRCCQ

    James River Coal (JRCC) -5.8% premarket following yesterday's 9.9% swoon after S&P cut its...

    James River Coal (JRCC) -5.8% premarket following yesterday's 9.9% swoon after S&P cut its corporate credit rating one notch further into junk territory, expecting profits and revenues in 2012 and 2013 to come in lower than forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • SUPN

    Supernus (NASDAQ:SUPN) soars 40% after it receives tentative FDA approval for its Trokendi XR...

    Supernus (NASDAQ:SUPN) soars 40% after it receives tentative FDA approval for its Trokendi XR treatment for epilepsy. Final authorization is conditional on Supernus resolving a marketing exclusivity issue regarding a specific pediatric population. The FDA also denies a Citizen's Petition filed in 2011 by Upsher Smith Labs related to its NDA on Trokendi XR.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • NWS

    Shares of News Corp. (NASDAQ:NWS) move up 2.8% in premarket trading off of reports tipping off...

    Shares of News Corp. (NASDAQ:NWS) move up 2.8% in premarket trading off of reports tipping off that the company may be split in two. Liberum Capital's Ian Whittaker speculates Rupert Murdoch's motivation behind a potential spinoff of the company's publishing division is that it would enable a freed-up News Corp. to make another run at British Sky Broadcasting (BSYBY.PK).

     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM
  • MS

    Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS) is removed from Goldman's Conviction Buy list and passes right by a Buy...

    Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS) is removed from Goldman's Conviction Buy list and passes right by a Buy rating, moving all the way down to Neutral. High capital markets exposure and implications from last week's Moody's downgrade are among the reasons. Shares -2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 AM
  • JPM

    The recent drop in JPMorgan (NYSE:JPM) attracts Goldman Sachs with move onto the firm's...

    The recent drop in JPMorgan (NYSE:JPM) attracts Goldman Sachs with move onto the firm's Conviction Buy list. Goldman cites near term earnings and returns visibility and a favorable risk/reward. Shares +1.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:47 AM
  • SGQRF

    SouthGobi Resources (OTC:SGQRF) falls 8.2% in Hong Kong trading to the lowest level since its...

    SouthGobi Resources (OTC:SGQRF) falls 8.2% in Hong Kong trading to the lowest level since its 2009 listing after the company's operating report raised uncertainties over whether Chalco (NYSE:ACH) would move ahead with plans to buy a controlling stake in the miner. SouthGobi also said it reduced output in Q2 and warned of deteriorating market conditions.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 AM
